Civil Engineer (Experienced) Job at Goteh Construction




        
    

        
        Goteh Construction provides a broad spectrum of solution and expertiseto the Africa infrastructure sector. This broad capability enables us to offer our stakeholdersfull range of solutions from Design, Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Installation and Commissioning as well as Maintenance Management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer (Experienced)

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role/Objectives
     

            
    




	Construction Company seeks to recruit an Experienced Civil Engineer that would oversee the design, construction, and maintenance of the physical and infrastructural built environment, including works like roads, bridges, canals, dams, structures and buildings, power plants, water and sewage systems etc.


Job Role/Objectives


	Provide comprehensive day-to-day field supervision at the site. Ensure all construction is being performed to quality standards in compliance with design specifications, drawings, budget and schedule.
	Conduct technical, feasibility studies and site investigations to establish effective and efficient project executions.
	Identify and resolve project design and development problems
	Recommend measures to enhance improvement or efficiency opportunities that may arise.
	Coordinate field work including contract work, to ensure compliance with company standards, procedures, specifications and codes.
	Identify and implement construction-specific opportunities for improvement.
	Test building materials for quality and provide costs estimates and labour required for each project.
	Assess the environmental impact and risks connected to projects.
	Up-to-date knowledge of local, state and federal government/agencies rules, standards and procedures.


Qualifications and Requirements


	A First Degree or Masters from a recognized University in Civil Engineering
	Minimum of 5 years of post NYSC experience in construction and project execution.
	Being a member of the Nigerian Society of Engineers and COREN is desirable.
	Professional membership with any internationally recognized engineering body (E.g PMP, PRINCE2) is desirable
	Ability to work with design engineers, clients and contractors.
	Ability to work with CAD Packages.
	Excellent time management skills in order to handle competing deadlines.
	A high level of autonomy and self-efficiency with attention to detail.
	Intermediate use of general computer programs such as packages in the Microsoft Office Suite.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV attached with a Cover Letter, passport photograph, Degree Certificate, NYSC Certificate and any other professional/relevant certificates in one (1) email to: recruitment@fiphs.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Candidates who do not comply with the above directives would be disqualified.

  "description": "Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our client is a technology-driven agribusiness platform that is transforming the way food moves from farmers to businesses. Due to expansion, they&nbsp;are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Efficiently manage the CEO&#39;s schedule, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Prioritize appointments and ensure the CEO is adequately prepared for each
	engagement.

Warehouse Assistant Job at Bible Society of Nigeria




        
    

        
        The Bible Society of Nigeria (BSN) believes the Bible is for all Nigerians. Traditionally, the work of the BSN is to make the Bible available and affordable. The Society has come to see that provision of the printed text, however well-presented, is only a part of the task. To achieve the most effective and meaningful distribution, the BSN also recognizes the need to develop programmes, using all forms of media to stimulate and facilitate encounter with the biblical text in Churches and public places. We actualize our mission through five major functions, namely: Translation, Publishing, Distribution, Programmes and Fundraising.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant
     

            
    



Job Location: Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Receiving stock from the ports as required.
	Prompt processing of stock requisitions from distribution representatives. Cross-checking stock issued to other locations against waybills for accuracy.
	Timely and accurate posting of waybills and return-to-stock documents on QuickBooks.
	Compiling and submitting daily and weekly reports as stipulated.
	Ensuring zero stock discrepancies at all times.
	Conducting daily stock reconciliation using QuickBooks.
	Performing other assigned duties as required.


Personnel Specification


	National Diploma (OND) in Accounting or Business Administration (or related discipline).
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
	Proficiency in QuickBooks Accounting Package.
	Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
	Initiative and proactiveness.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Effective time management.
	Ability to work well in a team-oriented environment.
